Redhat Server Post installation work

Steps from the server that is being built

  1. Login to the ADMIN server
    1. For DRiV
      ssh pcdcunxaxap01
    2. For Tenneco
      ssh pgnmsv01
  2. Login to the server (as root) you just built
    sudo ssh <hostname>
  3. A basic North American resolv.conf is installed, for specific sites in NA and EU, please click the link
  4. Setup correct timezone for servers please click the link
  5. For NA servers NTP is already configured, for European servers please click the link
  6. Update the information file

Steps from the Master server

  1. For DRiV - Login to pcdcunxaxap01
    ssh pcdcunxaxap01
  2. For Legacy Tenneco - Login to pgnmsv01
    ssh pgnmsv01
  3. Copy SSH keys, sudoers, uuma and such
    sudo /prod/images/scripts/config_tenneco_linux <servername>
  4. Setup lpar2rrd agent
  5. Send ticket for netbackup
  6. Send ticket for Monitoring
  7. Send a ticket to “GIOS Operations - Entitlement” to add the systems.
  8. For SAP servers - additional steps are needed -- Click here
  9. For OMI servers - additional steps are needed -- Click here
  10. For Network Monitoring servers - additional steps are needed -- Click here
  11. For Security servers - additional steps are needed -- Click here
  12. Shutdown the VM
    ssh ${server_tenneco}

    Shutdown 

    sudo init 0
  13. Remove the installation CDROM
    1. On VMWARE based systems
      Edit settings on the vSphere client and remove the isofile mapping to Virtual CDROM
Make it client device

      Once done –> Power on the VM

    2. On standalone NBU home made appliances
      ssh LAN@${server_tenneco}rmb

      Eject the CDROM 

      vm cdrom eject

      Exit from iLO 

      exit
  14. Patch the server to the latest version of RHEL6 or RHEL7
  15. For Netbackup home made appliances - additional steps are needed -- Click here
  16. After the installation check the kickstart logs to make sure there were no errors
    sudo more /root/ks-pre.log
sudo more /root/ks-post.log
